description: Unique flavors, especially like the Moscow Mule and Oaxaca Chili Chocolate! They have vegan, gluten-free, options for everyone. Innovative frozen yogurt with variety of toppings like mochi, fruit, boba, cereal etc
author: Sonam N.

description:
Easy Breezyis a great alternative to ice cream when you're itching for a sweet treat. After the Castro location closed, I started coming up the hill to Noe Valley to satisfy my cravings. Easy Breezy offers bold flavors that come in a variety of dairy and non-dairy options -- including low-fat, full fat (omg ew), coconut milk and cashew milk -- so there's always something for everyone. With that being said, however, I wish they had more flavors. When comparing to other yogurt shops, the 8 flavors (4 have residency, 4 rotate) really isn't a lot.

Other takeaways: toppings are ample, staff is friendly, awesome punch card, prices are slightly above average and bathrooms are a bit stinky.
author: Bryan D.

description:
Do NOT order delivery. I'm such a sucker! I just tried for (no joke) the 4th or 5th time. I have never had a successful delivery completed.  
I've talked to the owner with this feedback over a year ago. What has been done? Nothing. They still advertise to deliver and it's still terrible. 
I just ran there with 10 minutes to closing to grab one since mine never showed and asked the worker what I should do since it never arrived. She looked at me and said, "I don't know. Stop ordering." Yup. Smart girl. Probably not what the owner wants her telling customers, though. I then asked her if she hears from others about the delivery being dreadful and she said, "Yes. All the time."
They know they shouldn't advertise delivery and they still do it.
author: Nikki M.

description: I am giving it a 1 star because they are sucking the public dry with their prices. I came in with my son after he had a hard day as a treat and we both got a medium size yogurt that came to $25.00!!! This place is highway robbery. It is so not cool. Yes it is good but it is just frozen yogurt? What the hell? I wish there was a yogurtland here in SF as they are just as good and half the price. This place is taking advantage of people and for that I don't like them.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I had the opportunity to visit Easy Breezy recently and totally fell in love!

Although it's a bit pricey, it's one of the best froyo places I've had in the city! Not to mention, the staff member that helped me out (I wish I could have caught her name) was AMAZING! She made my first time experience so fun and memorable!

I got to sample a ton of their flavors! Some of their classic and permanent flavors include the Tart Yogurt, Vanilla Custard and the Chocolate Milk Yogurt. Some of their seasonal flavors include the Top Notch Butterscotch, Cucumber Mint and Hella Nutella.

I ended up getting the Vanilla Custard and Hella Nutella swirl, along with the Cucumber Mint, which was my absolute favorite! It's so refreshing and delicious! Easy Breezy also have a ton of toppings ranging from cereal, chocolate and gummy candies, along with fruits, mochi, syrups and wafers!

Overall, I had a great time here and enjoyed their yogurt. It's definitely a trip, but whenever I'm in the area I will come back for more!
author: Julia L.

description:
I came in after an event and totally loved the vibe! It was nice and clean inside and the toppings were kept clean. I decided on pumpkin (mind you, I went back in November and I'm just now writing this) and chocolate. Toppings of choice included almonds, chocolate chips, cookie bits and waffle cookies. Overall, the pumpkin tasted like pumpkin pie! Yum! It was really creamy and full of pumpkin flavor. The spices in it were spot on. You can never go wrong with chocolate so there's no complaints there. Both flavors together wasn't too great as the pumpkin overpowered the chocolate. I enjoyed every bit of the toppings on top. Loved that they had vegan options in there as well. My husband was with me and is lactose intolerant so he rarely enjoys treats like this.

I would definitely come back when I'm back in the city.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Dairy-free options, organic yogurt, and their use of local organic fruit - yes, please! Pricey, but worth it given the quality of what you're getting. They have some very unique flavors, lemon ginger zinger being my favorite, and toppings as well. I couldn't contain my enthusiasm as the young lady offered sample after sample. The atmosphere is so cheerful, looks like I've found my new favorite spot for frozen yogurt!
author: Ash K.

description:
If you're in the neighborhood, check it out! Easy Breezy is a cute little fro yo spot with tons of classic and fun flavors. They have a good selection of toppings with half of them being a wide assortment of gummy candies (my favorite). 

You can definitely taste the quality in their yogurt! It's not like yogurt land at all. It's creamier and the flavors are more rich.

With it being more on the pricier side, I prob won't be coming in all the time, but if I'm on 24th it would be a good spot to end my night.
author: Courtney N.

description:
This place has THE BEST froyo flavors I've ever had! From the matcha to Mexican chocolate, each bite was packed with flavor and didn't taste like syrups. I got a dollop of 4 flavors and was happy with each.

The inside of this place is roomie and open, allowing my large group of 11 to comfortably sit and chat about how damn good these flavors were. 

If the prices were slightly cheaper, this would be heaven on earth. All in all, I would definitely stop by this place for my matcha yogurt fix the next time I'm here!!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Quite possibly the best froyo I've had, although it is pricey, the quality is great and everything is well thought out. I'm lactose intolerant and the dairy free flavor options were impressive. The toppings had everything from traditional fruit to more unconventional like potato chips, yum! Street parking tho, so you might have to walk. 

4 stars for the high price point, parking situation and I can see why this place would feel super cramped on a busy day
author: Kristen B.

description:
This is my neighborhood froyo spot. Easy breezy has the the best vanilla custard froyo flavor I've ever tried, mostly because it's made with egg and full fat cream, but it's absolutely mindblowiny delicious. It's really the only reason I go, and for the apple pie, that flavor is amazing.

I wish they'd continue to keep the yogurt chips topping though, but they don't seem to have them anymore. :/ 

This is without a doubt one of the best froyo places to exist because of the unique and one of a kind, rotating flavors and dietary friendly options such as yogurt made coconut or cashew milk, etc. 

They have a mango lassi flavor, which isn't the super traditional mango lassi most Americans would know because it includes a strong cardamom flavor, so I think this flavor should be called mango shrikhand instead, it's another Indian yogurt dessert for famously known for heavy amount of cardamom flavor. :) 

I think they rotate the flavors bi-weekly? Also, it is the priciest froyo spot I've visited, but that's because they use very fresh and local ingredients, and you can taste it!
author: Shruti D.

description: The yogurt/ice cream available there was very good, and they list out if it's a custard base, w the different fat contents. I went for almost all the flavors, I think there were less than 10, with some fruit on the bottom and sliced almonds on top. The entire thing came up to around $9 which is pretty expensive compared to yogurt land or even pressed juicery, so I wouldn't come here too often, but it's pretty good flavor wise and texture wise still.
author: Poppy P.

description: Taste ok I perfer nubi yogurt much cheaper. Anyways Not enough topping choices. Pricey. Parking is difficult but great spot for kids.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
Pros:
Variety of toppings including lots of sauces

Cons:
Not a great variety of flavors
They do sample cups for you
There is no flow to the line - the toppings are in the worst place
author: Chris S.

description:
Delicious froyo and toppings, nice vibe and everything BUT:  The prices have risen quite a lot in the last 2 years. It's so expensive that it deters me from going now. 

A suggestion: if you're going to price it at gourmet levels, make the cups smaller, so we fill up less. That's usually how gourmet food works - higher quality, smaller quantity.

The reality is that 1/3 full of the smallest cup is a plenty large serving - but you feel like it's not enough because it's not filling even the smallest cup.
author: Eve P.

description: Love this spot because they have great non-dairy options (always two flavors made with cashew or coconut milk) and are always letting you sample things before you decide on one. Most of the rotating flavors are good, except the birthday cake was way too sweet. I would really love it if they kept the banana non-dairy up forever though!
author: Shabnam E.

description: Sometimes it gets a bit busy, and overwhelming with the young kids running around and parents trying to weave in and out of the other people around. Overall, they have great flavors that are aware of any certain types of dietary restrictions and they are all listed on the board so everyone can see. I also really like how the workers do the samples for you, rather than you get them, to me that seems more like a clean way to facilitate testing the different flavors, and I sure do appreciate a clean space! I love the neighborhood vibe and the little downtown area, it certainly is in the perfect location.
author: Micah L.

description:
Okay, so we've been going to easy breezy on 24th for awhile now and today I couldn't believe that for two regular size vanilla yogurts with NO toppings they charged $19.20! Either they had servers that didn't know what they were doing or were purposefully over charging, or they've raised prices to a ridiculous level. I'll go get gourmet yogurt or ice cream at Whole Foods and get way more for $20! Never again. 

To update: the owner nicely contacted me to apologize and say that there was a problem they had corrected and then followed up by sending us coupons. 

The products are very good; toppings are great (love the brownies); but what we noticed when we went in recently was that the price is .81 cents per ounce! Not sure if the price has been jumping up a lot since they opened, but now when you get roughly a cup of yogurt (small size) with maybe 1/3 cup of toppings, it adds up to well over $5.00 a serving; which seems much higher than when we started going there years ago. 

While it is possible that this is the going rate for frozen desserts out at a shop, what we realized is for this price you can go get gourmet frozen desserts at the grocery store for half that price per ounce or go to Super Duper for the best organic soft serve I've ever had!

We like the shop, their posted commitment to treating their employees well, organic, high quality products and such, and want to support local businesses, it's just more than we can justify paying for dessert. Maybe once in a long while, but not regularly. Sorry :(
author: Artina M.

description:
I wanted to love this place because the frozen yogurt really is great but I cannot and will never rationalize spending this much money on a treat. It is literally throwing money down the drain. The moment I was told $15.00 for two smalls, it was instant regret. I'm all for enjoyment and spending extra every so often on something special but walk down to Subs Inc. for a scoop of Mitchells that will cost you ~$4.

Also, terrible store layout and melted too quickly.
author: Brittany A.

description: Yogurt is just OK, really limited flavor selection, basically 4 different types of vanilla, a chocolate and 1-2 less boring flavors. Biggest downside is it is really really overpriced, two medium sized yogurts (not even overfilled) cost $25, two larges can be $35+.  The only reason this place stays in business because they have no competition, please someone open another yogurt shop soon!
author: Peter S.

description: I like this place and I enjoy their frozen yogurt quite often because it is located in the same block where my best friend lives, that being said I get bored often by finding the same flavors over and over. The owners need to realize that part of the fun is to try & taste new flavors, and that's something that I haven't been able to do. Unless the shop changes its policy and brings in new flavors I will likely end at Nubi's or somewhere else I can find more variety.
author: Stella P.

description:
The cost is $0.75 per ounce which seems a bit pricey but I guess that's the going rate for frozen yogurt these days, but you can very quickly spend $7-8 for a big cup of frozen yogurt. 

The biggest plus is that they occasionally have peanut butter which is my favorite flavor and is often not carried at a number of shops. They often have a good selection of non-dairy options too. Seating inside is fairly limited but, not surprisingly, the seats turn quickly.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Whooohooo! Vegan frozen yogurt! I really enjoyed the different flavors they offered. It was clean, the different toppings were not overwhelming, and they didn't seem to be prepackaged toppings which is nice. 

It's located on a really cute street in SF so parking is not very easy. I would make this an after dinner stop for sure.
author: Stacey A.

description:
I would like to get behind this place, but my froyo was $8+ for 3/4 a cup.  I think it's $.79 an oz?!  

I went with my family and it was ~$37 for 4 frozen yogurts.  My kids filled their cups up and I couldn't be like no, put it back - LOL.  

When I was taken back at the sticker shock - the girl behind the counter was like "yeah, the price is listed."  Not friendly at all.  Probably gets this a lot.  

Overall, It's a rip-off and not a good experience for a family.  I'd rather run up to Whole Foods and get 3 pints for $21.  Three times the ice cream for half the price.  

Oh and strangely we asked for samples - the girl was very particular about measuring the sample...c'mon froyo isn't gold!  

Be forewarned.
author: Ursinha G.

description:
This place has interesting and unique flavors.  The inside boasts a large seating area, but the actual frozen yogurt dispensary and toppings area is a bit awkward.  The toppings are featured right next to the cash register, and on a table which rests on a weirdly located column in the middle of no where.  The line is confusing because in order to get toppings located on the table where the column is, you pretty much have to get out of line.  Then, once you're done getting all the toppings, do you simply go to the back of the line?  It is chaotic, to say the least.  

Then there is the issue of the toppings located right next to the register.  People are naturally indecisive and may take a long time choosing which toppings they want with their flavors.  Having the toppings right next to the register slows down the line.  

They offer shots of water by the seating area if you're thirsty.  Be prepared to take about 5 shots of water though, because the cups are small.  

In conclusion, they have some great flavors.  They also offer "organic" fruit as toppings which explains why they are able to charge higher than other "non-organic" froyo places.  The waffle is a must try.
author: Victor L.

description: The frozen yogurt is good (not as good as pink berry) but the service soured my whole experience. Usually I'm someone who really only cares about the food yet the person running the store (black hair about 5'6" and name stated with an "e") made me not want to come back. I was super excited to go in the first place and it was my first time. I arrive at noon and the door was open but it had the closed sign up. I thought maybe she just didn't switch over the sign as the door was open. I went in the store. She snapped and me and me told I couldn't come in the store as the frozen yogurt wasn't ready. She took her time adding spoons to the different containers - she obviously didn't look happy to be at work. Then at 12:06 she let me in the store. I asked to try most of the flavors (no one else was there and it was my first time). She looked very annoyed and then went quickly putting together the samples. I had my hands full of samples and then she held out the next sample and looked annoyed I couldn't hold yet another sample. I don't understand why she couldn't just place the samples on the table. She also provided such a small sample I could barely taste the yogurt. I'm glad I did a wide range of samples my first time as the cheesecake one was my favorite and I'd normally never order cheesecake. Also as an FYI they don't take Amex.
author: Gabs M.

description: So I had a yogurt craving. .. and got on yelp to see if there were any closeby spots for frozen yogo so instantly this place came up.  When I came here the guy who was behind the counter did not give us sample cups to try the yogurt because he probably thought that we were going to overdo it on the testers.  Instead he gave us the sample of the flavors we wanted to try. I got a small cup of vanilla custard and banana creme pie flavor for a total of $9.00 which was a lot for only a few ounces.  Lemme just say this yogurt spot is really expensive and the flavors are mushy & not even that great! I'd rather go to nubi yogurt, yummi yogurt or pink berry. Probably won't be coming back :/
author: Roxy P.

description:
This was a great place to go to. I loved the flavor selections and we had a $10 groupon to use. Let me tell you it was so hard trying to get $10 worth of frozen yogurt even with all the many many toppings.

We had about 6 flavors topped off with chips, chocolate pebbles, m&ms, mochi, strawberry syrup, popping bobas, cookie dough, etc.

This amount is great to share between two people.
author: Corie L.

description:
A froyo place that has a flavor called "Busta' Limes" deserves no fewer than 5 stars.

https://youtu.be/_VmqAGurarU
author: Amy C.

description: I am a Noe Valley resident so I was thrilled when they moved in. With 3 kids, having a frozen yogurt place just down the street is a bonus. The yogurt is really tasty. I had a bad experience there when I was overcharged for the frozen yogurt and the owner reached out to me promptly and offered me a few free cups. Watch the price and speak up if you feel it is more than it should be. Otherwise, this place is perfect.
author: Krista M.

description:
I made a surprise pit stop off at this quaint lil' froyo shop in order to surprise my babygirl with some Vegan froyo. It was difficult to surprise her since we circled the neighborhood several times in order to find parking. Good thing she doesn't know Noe Valley very well, or else she might've guessed where we were heading.

They had two non-dairy flavors to choose from. They aren't labeled "Vegan" on the machines, but I had checked enough beforehand to ensure that they are indeed Vegan. They have an almond or coconut milk base which is different from your usual soy. Good thing I checked online before heading here since the customer service was nonexistent. I know that Noe Valley is filled with pretentious yuppies, but it was the most unfriendly experience in a froyo shop that I could imagine. I think the only word that the guy at the register uttered was the cost of our bowl. Which, was actually quite reasonable since it's per ounce. I was expecting to pay much more.

We tried the mint flavor, which was okay. Kinda bland and not too creamy. It could've been the almondmilk base, which left it watery. There was also a lack of mint flavor which you can't blame on being Vegan. 

The Cake Batter however was the stuff of wet dreams. It utilized coconut milk to much better effect. I used to love me some Coldstone cake batter ice cream, back in the day. It was probably my favorite ice cream before I realized that cow's milk is for cows. This rendition of cake batter wasn't quite up there in creaminess, but it's damn good! I would say it's the best froyo in SF. Yogurt Farms in Santa Rosa might be better, but that's a helluva drive.

They rotate flavors often it appears. Whatever is on the menu, the coconut based version is the way to go. Not sure why on our visit the two Vegan flavors weren't on the same machine. This would allow you to do the swirly with the center handle that mixes the two. Only makes sense to me. 

They had some gourmet looking sauces and toppings, but due to the aforementioned lack of service, we went with some standard fruit toppings. We didn't want to bother the gruff gentleman at the counter with any more questions. A great choice as it allowed us to savor all the cake batter goodness. However, I would opt for some Oreos and chocolate sauce, or something else next time.
author: John B.

description: My first review! Well, Easy Breezy does have great frozen yogurt, but what struck me, perhaps on my 50th visit now, is that what brings me here is the magical feel of neighborhood. Just makes me happy spending 15 minutes in here. Great vibe.
author: Razmig H.

description:
Bottom line at the top: amazing froyo spot! Premium toppings and organic options too

--

Great spot! About six flavored labeled with fat content and super unique (read: non-Sysco truck) toppings. Yum!!
author: Dahlia S.

description:
Oh, frozen yogurt you say. Not another one. So over froyo. You've already tried Pinkberry or Yogurtland or Tuttimelon. Well, this is not your typical frozen yogurt place. You'll notice that as soon as you see their amazing topping choices.

In addition to great fresh fruit, there are yummy sauces, crushed potato chips, chocolate pebbles and tons more in addition to sprinkles, brownies, mochi and oreos. 

But wait, check out the yogurt. One could sample everything, and then use the machines to create one's own plus self serve toppings. The yogurt is weighed by the friendly, helpful employees. I tried lemon, tart and chocolate milk - all delicious! Nice space with well crafted wooden seating. I look forward to their new location in the Inner Sunset.
author: Carol W.

description:
Hanging out with my friends who live on the top of a steep hill in the Castro (above the Castro?), sometimes you want a nice, cool treat after a day of hiking, or other reasons. My friends are addicted to this place, and I now have a stamp card for here.

I like the revolving menu here. They keep some staples, but a lot changes based on season or who knows.

As boring as it sounds, I really like their vanilla. The past two trips I have definitely gotten it with another flavor. This most recent time, the flavor was taro. Mmm, purple yogurt.

So after you fill up your cup (in three sizes, and don't feel bad going for the kiddie size), you can add the toppings. NOTE: there are three toppings areas - one around the central pole, one by the register, and one with sauces to the left of the register. Definitely a gamut of options from bits of cereal and cookies, to nuts, candies, sauces, and I think sriracha.

Eating inside or out is fine, but don't forget some complimentary water.
author: Michael C.

description: Great frozen yogurt!! My husband and I were visiting my brother in SF, and he swears by this place. It definitely lived up to the hype. The employees serve you any samples you want, but you ultimately get to serve yourself when you're ready to fill your bowl. Unique flavors but would have liked to see a little bit more of a variety in them. They do have a vanilla custard option for those of you who are over the whole non-fat thing. It was DELICIOUS! Very cool and different topping options than at your usual place. Lucky charm marshmallows ONLY?! Yes please!! Small area to sit inside, but also some benches outside. Check this place out!
author: Christina C.

description:
I think by now I should own this place. I come here that often, yes!

Toppings
Cons: not as many.
Pros: very fresh and very good quality.

Froyo
Cons: .... I had to think this one for a while... I'm still thinking. Oh! Yes. Sometimes some flavors are too cold and frosty.
Pros: there are always new fun flavors. They have a range going from full to non fat. Non diary, gluten free, almost every dietary restriction is taken care here! 

Staff
Only pros! they are all awesome and friendly.
author: Maggie J.

description:
Date & Time:  Friday July 13, 2012 @ 4pm, Saturday July 14, 2012 @ 4pm, Wednesday July 18, 2012 @ 5pm
Companions:  Michael & Jack Waited Outside
Scene:  Noe Valley Families & Girls in Ambiance Sweaters Over Lululemon Groove Pants
Decor:  Nostalgic Tahoe Ski Lodge.  Log-Seating
Service:  Tom? is a Sweetheart.  Very Friendly
Devour:  Tom's Tart, Lime, Fresh Custard, Banana, Cake Batter & Milk Chocolate Fro-Yo
Total:  $10.98
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
A small yogurt place in the heart of 24th Street. 

Here is my review of all the flavors I had :

-vanilla custard: this is the reason I find myself coming back here. Although it is full fat, the guilt afterwards is worth it. It's so creamy, it doesn't taste like yogurt. It tastes like a high quality McDonald's I've cream cone with a richer texture and better mouth feel. This flavor is the reason for my high review 

(the following flavors cycle, so you may not find it here all the time. The custard is there though!) 

-classic tart: slightly sour, but still very rich. It doesn't taste like a non fat yogurt, but still doesn't stand out as amazing. If you're a fan of original tart at other places, got won't be disappointed 

-non-dairy basil: I was a little hesitant to try this in the beginning. I quickly jumped on it though (how often  do we run into basil yogurt?). The basic is incredibly strong, in a good way. If you love basil, you will love this flavor. If you don't, you may still like it as it does have the other delicious elements of yogurt (cold mouthfeel, sweetness, and tangy finish) 

-vanilla bean: this is the non fat version of the vanilla custard. If you're watching your calories and fat intake and want a nice vanilla yogurt, this is a good choice. It's not my go to though as the custard is so good! This one tastes a lot like the coffee beans vanilla bean beverage. 

-non-dairy chai spice: the chai flavor is definitely there but I was expecting a bit more from this one. The finish (after taste) is a bit dry and bland. For a dairy free option though, they've done a decent job.
author: Victor A.

description:
Great, classic froyo shop. I got the tart froyo with sprinkles and a shark gummy (in honor of shark week, obviously!) and it satiated all of my froyo desires. The selection of toppings was impressive, including crumbled bacon, lots of fruit, candies, cereals and sauces. 

Pricing was the pretty pricey standard for a boutiquey froyo shop -- $5ish for a full kids cup... 

The location was very clean and the low tables made it great for families with small children. Can't wait to go back!
author: Laura C.

description: The yogurt here is good but nothing special. But the thing that really disappointed me was the topping selection. The toppings seemed stale and old... For example all of the gummy candies were stuck together in a ball. They didn't have a lot of traditional toppings and most of the offerings were unappealing. This place is also quite expensive especially considering the quality.
author: Diana G.

description:
Come here if you're really into supporting really local business (as in you only shop in your neighborhood) and you have money to spare, I guess.

Lots of things here are to be expected. It's expensive. It's locally-owned. It has the kind of patrons who gesture toward the baby in their arms and say, "we're going dairy-free." It's vegan-friendly.

Perhaps I'm a Nubi's loyalist, but I don't see what stands out for people who actually eat traditional frozen yogurt. Sure it's cute (I really do love that little fro-yo cartoon and the wooden paneling), but it doesn't really have enough seating to be a cool hangout place. It's organic, but it doesn't taste any better than other frozen yogurt places. It has a wide variety of toppings and rotating flavors, but so does every other store. For a $10 frozen yogurt, I expect a bit more.
author: Cailin H.

description: This used to be my go to froyo place, but after today I won't be back. Way to expensive. Their were 4 of us, two got huge cups and two of us got really small cups and it was almost $40. This is just ridiculous for froyo.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Atmosphere: I don't know why but the first thing that comes to mind is country. It had a country feel. Maybe because I am at the very moment listening to country music. It's nice nonetheless, and it's not so cramp.

Yogurt: You get about 8 flavors to choose from. Grapefruit, cookies and creamboat, two different types of vanilla, tart, cake batter (it was gross), chocolate and I forgot the others. Some are "fat free". Haha

Service: not bad. The server gave us samples, and wasn't cheap on the samples.
author: Vinson H.

description:
Looking for a little dessert in Noe Valley? Love froyo? This is a new chain right? That day we were in SF I saw a whole bunch of these all over the place. 

It's simple. Tasty flavors. Really liked the custard. Full fat, but worth it! 55 cents per ounce, are you crazy? Yah, it's SF. Oh and it's organic. Just try it! Although I think it's a little weird to be eating a cold dessert at night in SF. COLD. Brrrr. Easy Breezy.
author: Cindy K.

description:
Self serve fro-yo with a great selection of toppings! I like to go with the vanilla custard topped with fresh strawberries, hot caramel, and hot fudge. They have a lot of other tasty non fat and dairy free options as well.

The tasty fro-yo, assortment of toppings, light atmosphere, and wonderful staff makes easy breezy the best thing on 24th street!!!
author: Tevy D.

description:
Easy breezy where have you been all my life, and why are you so expensive?

I don't know what they put in their froyo, but the texture is a lot more smoother and creamier than the usual places like yogurt land.

The fruits were fresh and I really liked the granola they had. Too bad I only noticed the hot fudge after we paid and the Chocolate flavor was out of order.

I'll be backkkk!
author: Carmen A.

description: Friendly service and popular neighborhood joint. Unseasonably hot weather today - in the 90s - means the line was out the door. Not cheap at 71 cents an ounce, but the yogurt choices are remarkable- two non dairy choices (I believe almond milk based: red velvet (!) and chai were offered today). These lacked the dairy taste but in a good way, still full of flavor and creamy texture.  Also had low fat Oreo brownie, yum.
author: Debora L.

description:
So over priced it's outrageous! Yes it satisfied my craving but so not worth it!!! I got a small with like 1 scoop of toppings and it was $7 and my cup wasn't filled up. Way too expensive. The froyo was tasty but not $7 worth. There was very few topping choices. Also the girl was rude who was at the counter. 

Side note - I think it's weird that when I asked to try a flavor they didn't just hand me a cup but filled it up themselves. 

All in all. Not impressed.
author: Beth E.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and right across the street, so I come here often. This place is self-serve so you fill up your empty cup with frozen yogurt (they have ~10 flavors) and choose from an assortment of toppings like fresh fruit, mochi, brownie bites, cheesecake crumbs, homemade waffle cone, heath bars, etc.  It's a bit pricey for fro-yo; they charge by the ounce so if you do go crazy, you'll pay for it both in money and in weight. 

Definitely come to this place for solid fro-yo!
author: Lillian C.

description:
WTF $7.50 for a tiny froyo? This is absolutely insulting.  I remember when these guys opened up in the neighborhood and they were a family, all excited and enthusiastic about their place. Being a Noe Valley resident, I want to support small businesses in the neighborhood and keep them going. The last few times I have run in for a TINY cup of tart froyo, I couldn't believe the price $7.50. 
I usually don't jump on Yelp to write reviews but this is not only outrageous but insulting. Plus their yogurt melts by the time you bring it over to pay for it. Not cool.
author: Josiane F.

description:
The husband and I are on our vacation mode dieting as per usual before we head off traveling, this is mainly so we can eat our hearts out once were at our destination. And last night post-Korean dinner, we really wanted to go for some cake or pie or something incredibly sweet and terrible for our waistlines. Instead, we decided to go for some froyo and even convinced ourselves it was okay to have dessert because it has a lower calorie count and fat content than the aforementioned. 

I used to go to this particular Easy Breezy all the time but haven't been in some time. Staff is always friendly, the place is kept tidy and their froyo texture has always been perfect - never too icy or too creamy and the tartness is just right, in my opinion anyway. Last night was no exception and I walked out happily with my cup of froyo topped with strawberries despite the chilly weather. 

Easy breezy - just as their name suggests.
author: Esther A.

description:
This has been the second time I visited an Easy Breezy! I didn't even know they had one in the Noe Valley area until I started working in the area.

The frozen yogurt here is great quality. Very smooth, not icy, flavors are on point and they even tell you the fat level of each one (full fat? non fat? med fat? Hmm.). You do not do self-serve sampling; instead the person working will help you out with that! However, you can try as many samples as you would like. The toppings here are slightly a little more "cooler" than, say Yogurtland. They offer jellies like what you would put in boba drinks, granola, organic cookie dough, colorful mochi, and huuge chunks of fruit. Oh, don't forget the many syrups and gummy candy!

I tried their green tea and vanilla custard today. It was soo delicious. I ended up sticking with the green tea topped with mochi and cookie dough. Too bad that it's way more expensive than Yogurtland with less flavors to offer :(. I would only come here once in a while, but it's definitely worth the treat if you feel self-deserving!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Flavors available today: chocolate milk, peanut butter, lime, tart, custard, taro, and vanilla bean. 
Consistency on most were good. A few were on the softer runny side.  
Good selection of toppings. 
Organic and tasty. 
Friendly service.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Pros: 
- fresh kiwi and strawberries toppings, but most places have these 
- chocolate and vanilla custard are both yummy, but definitely says 'full-fat' on it. But I like that they disclose this info.
- organic toppings option

Cons: 
- inconsistent customer service. There is often only one person working and since they have to get you the sample, you have to wait for him/her to be free to get a sample. The guy working there today must've been in a bad mood because I saw him snap at a customer saying that he has to ring everyone up first; therefore, he has to wait since he has to be the one to get the sample for him. 
- mushy sloshy fro-yo. I like mine more frozen. Theirs is often too soft and melts super fast. 
- uh, expensive? My barely half-full regular froyo and a kid size (again barely) half-full froyo came out to be $16. Many people being rung up were at $24, so I just paid it and didn't question it, but couldn't help wonder why the heck was it so expensive?! I used to go to Nubi Yogurt on 16th and Bryant and packed the entire cup with yogurt and fruit, and it was never this much. 

So I called around a bit to find out what other places charge: 
- Nubi: $0.39 per oz
- place b: (I'll fill in the names later) $0.43 per oz
- place c: $0.49 per oz
- place d: $0.53 per oz
- This place, Easy Breeze whatever: $0.61 per oz

No wonder, they add up.  There aren't any other yogurt places around in the neighborhood, so I guess they can charge an arm and a leg and still get a lot of customers. I will definitely think twice before coming here next time though.  Something about a $16 half-full froyo just doesn't sound right.  Let's say mine was $10 since we had the small kid's size too. Either way, $10 for a half-full froyo with bad customer service? Mmm, I think I'll hold off unless I absolutely had to have it at that exact moment.
author: Catherine H.

description:
This is the place we go when it's after 7 or 8, we've eaten too much dinner and we think that walking down Noe over the hill to 24th Street will somehow make enough room in our stomachs for froyo.

The froyo here isn't bad. It isn't great, either. But it's fairly good and it's open late and there's a lot to be said for that.

When you walk in you'll notice that it's warm. It doesn't really matter what the temperature is outside, but the heat from the machines definitely keeps this place at just-below-sauna levels at all points of the year. They have five or six flavors with a blackboard wall above each where the flavor is written. Quite advanced, I know.

The staff is nice, but often the froyo comes out too liquidy because of the aforementioned heat. Toppings are plentiful and it's the standard weigh-and-pay that you'd get at any other froyo place.

Bonus points for being open late most nights, but they suffer from a lack of flavor options (tart, vanilla and chocolate were three of the flavors on one of the nights I was there and when you're going up against Yoppi and places like that with Oreo and Cheesecake and Sparkling Unicorn, or as it's known Cake Batter, you've got to up your flavor game) and the flavors not really matching their ice cream counterparts.

Definitely worth stopping in if you're walking by, but not worth making a long trip. Unless it's late, and you want to walk off dinner.
author: Danny P.

description:
Adorable ritsy location and little set up. I think it's run by this guy who served me. And truly he's very into every part of your yogurt /custard picking. He gets the samples for you (I never ask but I suppose it helps people from messing up his super dainty establishment and wasting his sweat and blood labor).

Apparently this bro-blonde-surfer looking, crazy friendly 30-40's guy makes this stuff himself. It was delicious. Filled with kids and women who probably go just to check out this guy. 

Best part: all organic for you hipster kids out there. And DELICIOUS everything. He even had cut fresh figs! Who does that?! No one.
author: Alice ..

description:
Custard, Full Fat. Totally worth it.
I will miss you when my wife and I move to Oakland, Easy Breezy!
author: Edward F.

description:
I'm kind of a froyo loyalist. I love Yogurland, but for some reason since SF doesn't have a Yogurtland, I come to this place probably the most often out of other yogurt spots in the city. Mostly, because of it's convenience and it's never really a cluster to get in and out with the goods.

Probably 90% of the time I come in here, I'm the only person without a kid, so prepare to be bombarded by young children running around screaming with froyo. They usually have the staple froyo flavors and then have some random out-there flavors from time to time. I'm generally happy with the texture of the froyo itself. Sometimes, they can run a little dry of toppings that are popular like strawberries or bananas, but they almost always have the other popular dry candy toppings.

Don't forget to grab a punch card when you pay!
author: Shawn B.

description: I tried the new flavors: banana island and new york cheesecake. Both were pretty yummy! The reason why I give this ice cream shop only 3 stars it is because it cost me $5 a tiny cup of frozen yogurt. For five bucks I would have got twice as much at Nuby.
author: Serafin K.

description: Easy breezy is the best frozen yogurt place I have ever been to. They have flavors ranging from chocolate to Thai iced tea which by the way is delicious. They also change there flavors every week so it fun to see what amazing and unique flavor they have. Easy breezy also has a large toppings section that is also very unique.  It is definitely a must eat.
author: Paul G.

description:
Solid tart frozen yogurt here!  They also have other fun flavors, like custard. I think what makes this place unique is the toppings, since they have unusual ones like nectarines, whole Kit Kat bars, and yummy passion fruit filled boba pearls.  I also like the environment, it's very cozy and organic. Wooden paneling make this place seem new and fresh, and the little froyo signs are adorable - a little cup with arms, legs and a face!

They also offer a merchant discount if you work in the neighborhood!  Otherwise I think it is a bit expensive.  I paid $3.76 for around 7.8 ounces...50 cents per ounce. That's a lot comparing to Yogurtland, which I think is less than half of that.  But this place is a neighborhood spot, unique and one of its kind. 

FYI they have cute tshirts for babies + adults :)))))))))))))
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Obscenely overpriced at 0.75/ounce. Quality self serve frozen yogurt places that I've visited average around 0.45 cents. That makes a small portion is $6.
author: Roger S.

description: Vegan froyo? Yes, please!  Frozen yogurt outings is one of the things we've missed since my teen went vegan, so we were thrilled to discover Easy Breezy.  According to the employee there, the rotating menu always includes at least two vegan flavors.  We tried S'mores, which was cashew milk based, and Grapefruit, made from coconut milk.  Both were delicious, and unique, with S'mores tasting creamier, more like traditional froyo.  Grapefruit was such an interesting texture- like froyo and gelato had a baby.  The only thing I'd like to see added is signage pointing out which toppings are vegan-for instance, fruit is obvious, but dark chocolate pearls???  Some syrups could be vegan, too, but we didn't know so we had to skip.  The counter lady wasn't sure, either, so we just went for fruit and nut toppings.  We'll definitely be returning to try more flavors!
author: Lorraine V.

description:
I heard that a Pinkberry opened somewhere in SF, but as a resident of Noe Valley, I guess now I don't really give a hoot.

=D

Since I live only a couple blocks away, I felt a stronger-than-average urge to capitalize on this Hot New Biz (ten minutes from first seeing the listing to setting foot in the door). The interior is clean, with mostly wood finish and an aqua trim. Seating for patrons includes a couple sturdy, wooden benches and little stools by the window.

The flavors offered are as Lolia S. described. I'm no fro-yo aficionado but the tart had a nice balance of creaminess and tang. I added a few bits of peach to my bowl, which rounded it out nicely.

Some talking points:
+ The six flavors are arranged in three pairs, each with the standard swirl option in between.
+ Fruit toppings. Check.
+ Candy and sweet toppings. Check.
+ A couple sauces to drizzle on your creation. One of them of a chocolate variety.
+ Loyalty cards! Go local!
+ Extremely friendly staff.

I dare say, 24th street is now complete.
author: Alex C.

description:
Being vegan and loving my desserts, as soon as I heard that Easy Breezy always offers one vegan flavor I went over there today to try it out.

Since it was my first time I was a little lost when I walked in. It's all self serve, which I didn't know before going. The flavors are written on a chalkboard above each self-serve machine; and the vegan flavor isn't actually labeled "vegan" but "non-dairy". 

Once I got that figured out I started checking out the toppings. Around the pole in the middle are toppings like crushed potato chips, Fruity Pebbles, and Oreo crumbles. Not really my thing, even if some of them are technically vegan.

To the left of the cash register are the sauces, and the hot peanut butter sauce is vegan. And delicious. If there weren't employees around I would be tempted to just put my face under it and squirt it into my open mouth. To the right of the cash register are the fancier toppings like blueberries, cut strawberries. and mochi bits (which are vegan and delicious. They checked the ingredient list for me to make sure, and I totally appreciated that).

Once you've got your strategy planned you choose a cup from three different sizes. I chose the smallest one just in case since it was my first time to make sure I liked it. I wasn't sure what to do at the dispenser machine under the vegan flavor, so I put the cup underneath it and tried pulling the handle down but it wouldn't move. I thought maybe it was locked so I tried the next handle over, but that was for a "swirl" of two flavors, one of which wasn't vegan.

Fortunately the two employees were watching me do this (and probably enjoying seeing a clueless customer trying to get at their product with slapstick results), and they told me that the handle I was pulling wasn't entirely vegan. I offered to pay for the fro yo I had put in the cup with the wrong handle, but they said don't worry about it and took it in back and said to try the vegan handle again. This time I got it to work (note to self: start doing arm curls at the gym...), and once the fro yo was in the cup I added the peanut butter sauce, some strawberries, and some mochi bits and put it on the scale.

It was $6 for my cup, which was actually less than I thought it was going to be. Even though it was the smallest cup size I think that's a really fair price for what I got. People who are complaining on here that it's expensive should just stick to $2 tubs of corn syrup and sugar "ice cream" from the store. And not get so much.

The trash receptacles I saw in the shop were all for composting, which is good because the cups, spoons, and napkins are all compostable (as is any food residue of course). The shop was clean and simple with windows onto 24th for people watching.

I was a little hesitant to go here and almost decided to go to the Irving location instead. I'm a kid kicker, and there tend to be a lot of kids around Noe Valley. But there was a family with two kids when I got there who weren't too out of control or annoying. Right before I left a family with two kids did come in, and the dad parked the ridiculously oversized SUV stroller along one bench and they proceeded to take up two tables; but it seemed like there was enough seating for people and the turnover is fast enough where no one had to stand.

The two people working there were both really nice and helpful, especially since I felt like a mouthbreather when I first walked in because I wasn't sure how it worked. They helped me along each step of the way, and were on top of my dietary restrictions (vegan) the whole time, which was appreciated. They were offering samples to quite a few people who came in after I got my fro yo and sat down, so they definitely aim to please here and it's nice to see people being proactive and not just phoning it in and standing around talking to each other and filing their nails while you're trying to get the food in your face.

I could see going here regularly. It was a good hike over the hill from the Castro, and the cup I ate didn't feel like it was heavy in my stomach on the walk back home. Oh, the vegan flavor today was cherry marzipan. It tasted like cherry soft serve fro yo, not overly sweet, and the consistency was just right. I guess I should mention that the frozen yogurt was good since it's in the title and that's what you'd be coming here for.
author: Brent R.

description:
This place has AWESOME flavors. I personally am dairy free, so the fact that they almost always have a dairy free option for me (that is nice and creamy unlike non dairy options at other places) is the main reason I keep coming here. Today I had the dairy free chai flavor - yummmmmmy!

 Yes, the price per ounce is a bit more than other places (60 something cents and ounce, yogurt land is around 40 cents I believe) so that's why I took off one star. However, overall I love this place. Keep the awesome flavors coming Easy Breezy!
author: Sam S.

description: This place is legit.  Got the vanilla and the peach fro yo.  Put some fresh berries on.  Refreshing and delicious.  Service was nice and polite, too.  Couldn't have been better.
author: Lee S.

description:
Since I'm not a huge frozen yogurt connoisseur I will be brief

Yogurt was creamy while maintaining a decent body. The flavors were present and distinguishable with the exception of the Nutella. 

I'm not sure where the WOW factor was because I certainly didn't have one. I though it was standard yogurt done well.

Overall Thoughts

I would go back but not something I would go out of my way to get
author: Eddie W.

description: Came here on a warm Thursday afternoon.  Cute, convenient location in Noe Valley.  Adorable mascot.  I had to check it out.  As soon as I walked in I was offered samples.  Such great, friendly service!  I went with the Vanilla Custard and the Ginger Snap (non-dairy!) and I loved it.  I tried the Vanilla Bean also and it was a really good, nostalgic flavor, but I went for the Vanilla Custard because it was just so creamy.  I was very impressed with the topping selection as well.  I liked the brownies and the salted caramel rocks.  I will have to come back for the popping boba and must try the bacon on my froyo at some point.
author: Audrey D.

description: We go to the hot tub in the rear of the business which is rad! This yogurt though is about $12 a pound. The flavor doesn't deserve the price. We will bypass this in the future. Not amazing.
author: Disco B.

description: Great froyo, great toppings , nice store but crazily over priced. Hard to beat this though when hungover, in noe valley, with a tasty dessert and just chilling
author: Jack O.

description:
A bit pricey yes, but hello, look around, you're at 24th and Noe.
I'll drive across town to get froyo here.
Milk Chocolate and Tart - have great texture and are delicately smooth.
Courteous and friendly staff.
Don't forget to punch that frequent customer card.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
My husband and I go here probably 3x a week, this is definitely our neighborhood go-to for dessert.

So delicious. Great, fresh yogurt flavors. So far, absolute favorite is their grapefruit, but also really enjoy the taro, pumpkin, chai (with almond-milk!), vanilla bean, and just regular tart yogurt.

For toppings, there's a fun mix of stuff. Their fruit always looks good, and their lychee mini boba balls and passionfruit boba balls are very tasty.

Also their staff is always nice, and like that they have a chalkboard with everyone's cartoon drawing of themselves up there - fun neighborhood spot!
author: Annie M.

description: This is my second time here with my little brother and we just LOVE it! Not only is it a nice place in a beautiful and calm area, but it's DELICIOUS! We can't get enough of this place!
author: Misshell R.

description:
This yogurt place is in my neighborhood and my son loves it - I really do appreciate how kid friendly they are and the fact that most things are organic.  The staff that work there are nice and helpful.

As for the yogurt, for me, the flavors are hit or miss.   The flavors always sound better than they are, and I usually default toward the standard Tart flavor.   Pricing is pretty reasonable, but I do hate how fast the yogurt comes out of the dispensers.  Also, while I appreciate the free water, the dixie cups are usually a huge mess especially with the little ones.

All in all - a decent neighborhood yogurt shop.
author: Dana B.

description: I love that they have non-dairy options for the lactose intolerant & my son who is allergic to cow's milk.  The team members are friendly and helpful.
author: Maria B.

description:
I brought my child here as a treat after a blood draw. Meh. After spending $9 on two small portions, I was left with a brain freeze and not much more. The flavors were indecipherable (vanilla custard & nutella). The various toppings were a nice touch. Guess I should have put more on to get some flavor out of my dessert. 

I'll buy my child another frozen yogurt from here some day, but I think I'll skip my own next time.
author: Holly B.

description:
This place is like heaven in your mouth. It is so freakin delicious...omg. I totally recommend this place, its my new favorite soft serve in the world.

Helluh yummy flavors (like vanilla custard and nutella)
And helluh yummy toppings
And the fudge is da bommmbbbb

Going back tomorrow (:
author: Kendra Z.

description: I'd seen Easy Breezy on Irving in the Sunset. Today I went on a walk with my friend in Noe Valley and felt like trying this place finally. I had the non-fat raspberry flavor. I had gummy and bubble toppings. It was good. They charge by weight and I thought it was a little more expensive at about $5.50 for a decent helping. I'd come by again.
author: Denise C.

description:
Too expensive compare to others. Also they didn't let me taste the flavours as an auto service as others do.
The taste was pretty good.
author: Andrea O.

description: When is this place open? Not when they say they'll be. Certainly not at 9pm on Monday.
author: Jessica M.

description: Deceiving advertisement. In store it says the Strawberry Breeze flavor is full fat but online it says non-fat. Funny how the in-store signage changed after review for not having enough full fat options.
author: Brooke F.

description: So delish..so fresh..the nicest staff that is willing to give your kids 3 samples without ever a eye roll or attitude...you really could not ask for more!
author: Noe V.

description: I thought this place was a laundry mat LOL. Very cute place and friendly service. They had salted caramel flavor today so I have that along with tart then added almonds on top - yummy! Be careful with your toppings it's $.61 an ounce. But the yogurt is well worth it! Will come back soon :)
author: Tere C.

description:
My #1 option for froyo and I'm so glad they opened another location on Irving and 8th in the inner sunset.

1 and only home run flavor: full fat - vanilla custard

toppings? Plenty of them to choose from. But the best: Cheese cake pieces go so good with the full fat vanilla custard. 

Keep up the great flavors Easy Breezy! Damn i'm craving for some right now
author: Kenny L.

description: This place is amazing. It looked really busy outside so we thought why not go in. The guys were really helpful explaining the self service and giving free samples. I had the vanilla custard yogurt with pretty much every choccy topping in the shop. In comparison to other peoples selection I looked like a right fatty but oh well it was our first time and I have half in the freezer for tomorrow. The yogurt is so tasty and if I went again I'd just have that with the salted caramel Turtles - soooooo goooood! I didn't manage to take a decent pick because I made it look a mess in under a minute! I'll be back!
author: Kelly M.

description:
Absolutely Delicious, best frozen yogurt I ever had. 

The Lychee and Passion Fruit boba burst balls is hella good.

I just wish they did all flavors in full fat, cause fat is where the flavor is at!!!!
author: David L.

description: Really cool trendy place to get fro yo. They make all their yogurt from scratch with dress ingredients. The workers are very nice and if you're a first timer they will give you a discount! They have all unique flavors with interesting twists!
author: Ali H.

description:
Froyoflation.

Snicker-Doodle Dandy was dandy indeed. Unique and delicious cinnamon sweetness.

Chocolate Milk and Vanilla Bean were just a step behind. Tasty without being overpowering. Can't go wrong with a Straus Family Creamery foundation.

As others have mentioned the small space is well designed and eco friendly. Limited interaction with the staff was friendly and pleasant.

Everything was great till the bill. $6 and change for half a cup? Do home mortgage loans now apply to froyo habits? Are rents that bad? Straus that expensive?

Four star product with a one star ROI.
author: Jason B.

description: Friendly service. Yogurt with ingredients that include egg yolks and other types of 'milks' making it a very indulgent treat. Variety of toppings. All good except it is pricey compared to other yogurt shops. Like another reviewer stated, if you're all about organic and local, this is your place.  Often times, I just want a simple, tangy frozen yogurt with mochi but don't want to break the bank so this would not be my go to place.
author: K. S.

description:
My favorite frozen yogurt place ever.

Their cookie dough is SO fresh and soft and not just those bogus little prepackaged balls that almost every single other fro yo place has.

They have SO many toppings and sauces and change what they have often. Their fro yo flavors are all delicious and rich and creamy.

The staff is also unusually upbeat and seem excited to give samples and are super nice. I LOVE this place!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
So easy, so breezy. Hot tip: ask for the secret ingredients behind the counter. Also, tart may be the obvious choice, but IMHO, it remains the best.

Also, the giant window offers a nice view of Noe Street.
author: David C.

description:
If Wes Anderson opened a fro-yo shop, this would be it. Wood-paneled and sea-foam green accented, Easy Breezy looks like a dreamy beach cabin nestled into the maternal arms of Noe Valley. 

My roommates and I ventured over after seeing their fabulous reviews on Yelp, and we are so excited to become regulars. The whole shop is eco-friendly and zero-waste, and the fro-yo itself is dee-licious. Personally, I'm all about the toppings, and they have everything you could ever want from butterfly-shaped gummies to mochi to potato chip crumbles. The fro-yo flavors rotate too so it's always a fun surprise! 

We are so in love with this place that we leisurely enjoyed our fro-yo in-house amongst San Francisco's best-dressed toddlers and lululemon clad mothers (and fathers). This is world's coziest, most adorable fro-yo establishment--I can't wait to go back!
author: Meredith C.

description: Excellent vegan options including two flavors each day (I've tried the citrus hibiscus, chai and pumpkin patch) and several vegan toppings. They were even able to show me the ingredients for the mochi so I could confirm that they were vegan :). Other vegan toppings include nerds, Oreos and fresh fruit.
author: Josh B.

description: It costs alot more than other yogurt shops. My small cup cost more than $7. The place good for people will lots of cash to spend, maybe of this neighborhood?
author: Sapphire D.

description: Had some great chocolate almond milk frozen dessert! They even watched my dog while I served myself!!
author: Jeanette P.

description: Pure AWESOMENESS!!!  Consistently excellent quality frozen yogurt with great options for flavors and toppings, including fresh fruit of good quality.  The yogurt offerings are diverse and provude options for those on restricted diets.  The service is always friendly and helpful and the patrons are always smiling.
author: Sandra M.

description: Tired of froyo touting how itself as a healthier alternative to ice cream? Fear not! Easy Breezy now offers custard, a full fat version that tastes more like thick soft serve. The only place I've come across frozen custard was in Wisconsin. In fact, all of the froyo flavors here tasted thicker than the average froyo shop. The selection wasn't too large, but they did have seasonal flavors. At the time, they offered candy cane and egg nog in addition to the traditional flavors of tart, vanilla bean, and chocolate milk. Most importantly, they had mochi as one of the toppings.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
The 2 stars are for the decent tasting and creative yogurt flavors.

This place replaced the frozen yogurt license of what is now the second San Tung 2 and drove Tutti Melon out of the Sunset, replacing places where you could get a $5-8 cup of frozen yogurt with 59 cent per ounce yogurt.  I thought that was pretty bad, but paid the extra bill because the yogurt is interesting and the only close by choice.  Today I got less yogurt than usual and it cost more money - I looked at the wall and they are now charging 71 cents per ounce!!!  That's a 20 cent increase out of nowhere in about a year's time.  

It's bad enough rent and housing prices have become astronomical in this city.  Now you can't even get an affordable cup of frozen yogurt without driving to Yogurtland.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Easy Breezy is a good place to get your froyo fix, but it's a little different than what has become the standard. Some unique flavor offerings (bacon, finally!) and toppings, and a 15-cent per ounce Noe Valley tax.

 You could say I left the place a little chapped, however. No crushed Oreos? Cap'n Crunch cereal, but no Oreo's? Granola and no Oreo's? 

Your mind won't be blown, but let's face it, there just aren't a ton of froyo options in the parts of the city with low crime rates.
author: Marcus C.

description:
OK, in all honesty...the best, creamiest frozen yogurt I have had in the city. Never watery or icy (gross).  Great toppings too!

The draw back...
Too many strollers inside. There is space in the hallway entrance to park them so leave them outside! I went there today and was blocked by about 4 women with strollers who were just tasting things. Not to be rude, but I pushed my way past them. I don't know what it is about Noe Valley women with strollers that have such a sense of entitlement. Makes me sick!

I know this neighborhood is heavy on the foot traffic (and strollers) but seriously - limit the amount that are allowed inside at one time and ask people to park them outside. No one wants to trip over a stroller the size of big foot that probably is worth more than my car!
author: Katie S.

description:
My goal as I walked in was to get a nice refreshing cup of frozen yogurt with fruit while my heart and stomach desperately wished I were closer to Pink Berry! But upon discovering their CUSTARD oh my goodness. ... DELICIOUS. It's like the most delicious, creamy thing I've ever had. Take a spoonfull with strawberries and you think to yourself, did I just eat a strawberry shortcake? Definitely your not so healthy splurge of happiness!  (5/5)

I tried the original tart and the chocolate. I thought their  original tart wasn't really TOO sweet at all and pretty zesty. More icey than creamy (3.5/5). The chocolate was pretty good, a balance of creamy and sweet with a chocolate taste that leaned more towards a cocoa dark vs a milky. (4/5). 

Toppings galore! Their toppings are done in a small space, so take a good look. They have multiple types of syrups -- marshmellow fluff, peanut butter, chocolate and a bunch of dry ingredients. I think their mochi is one of the best i've tasted!

Parking isn't too bad in the neighborhood, it's really close to Whole Foods. You can get groceries AND fro yo in one trip! 

After $6 for a small cup of fro-yo, I've decided that I'm probably going to fill up a stamp card pretty soon! It can get pricey pretty fast if you get topping happy, but you will enjoy!
author: Christine B.

description:
Noe Valley is one my favorite neighborhoods to visit. When I found out about Easy Breezy, I knew that I had to pay it a visit. Brand new frozen yogurt place, located in Noe Valley, and they're eco-friendly. I'm sure that most food businesses are into the whole earth-friendly approach. That's just another plus! The decor is absolutely adorable. From the nature inspired chairs, benches, and even their walls. It's very kid-friendly.  Unlike all of the other frozen yogurt places around the city, which have a very modern feel to them. It's definitely the place to go to on lazy Sunday afternoons. 

As for the frozen yogurt. I should start out by saying that the texture is VERY creamy. It's almost like eating soft serve ice cream. But healthier! Some of their flavors are organic and non-fat. They have a good variety of flavors. My boyfriend and I tried their Cake Batter and Vanilla Bean. We also tried a sample size of their Chai flavored yogurt. The texture was like I said earlier, creamy. But i'm not much of a chai tea lover, so that flavor didn't really win my interest. Cake batter tasted OK. I didn't expect much from it though. My favorite as of now would be Vanilla Bean. I love anything that's vanilla flavored. Vanilla over Chocolate!  It was JAM PACKED with vanilla bean flavor. Very poignant flavor. And not bland at all. Creamy frozen yogurt + jam packed vanilla bean flavor = AMAZINGGGGG!  

I'm definitely coming back here to try their other flavors. As for the price, I can't quite remember how much they charge, but I paid a total of $6 for a good amount of froyo. It's a bit pricier than other places, but it's definitely worth it.
author: Nataly T.

description: Apple pie yogurt....Must have! They have seasonal flavors, and the apple pie one is the one for this month. It's DELICIOUS!
author: Brian L.

description:
Easy Breezy knows customer service! I love Easy Breezy because they provide FRO-YO for dairy free customers (and its not SORBET..YAYA!) Their dairy free yogurt is CREAMY AND SWEET and I cant get enough. 

This past weekend I had some of their dairy free peanut butter and it tasted a little off. Quickly the employees and I found out it had a dairy in it. Joey, one of their staff members, was so kind and forgiving and really went out of his way to fix the problem.  They shut down the machine and I got a very sweet email from the owner apologizing and checking in with me and my family!   

I will DEFINITELY be bringing my family back to this lovely place for both their great Fro-yo and their stellar customer service.  Take notes Corporate America...This is how a business should be ran!
author: J. Hunter R.

description:
Super cute yogurt shop tucked away in the lovely noe valley district.
Delicious flavors like the original tart, vanilla bean, custard, chocolate, + banana creme pie(YUM!!!!!)- cant go wrong with any of those options. They have all the worthy toppings like assorted fruits, mochi, almond, cookie dough, waffle cookies, etc!

They also reward their frequent-goers with a stamp-card-buy 10cups and get 1 on the house- (DOUBLE WIN-YAY!). I love businesses that treat their loyal customers with a bonus! Definitely another reason to visit this joint at least weekly and not feel guilty:)

CONs: Although it's a self-serve froyo joint, it's about $5-6 per small cup! so tip to the money-savy-do NOT fill up unless you plan to spend $8 bucks for a cup of yogurt.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Went tonight for the first time, after dinner for my daughter's 11th birthday.

I tried the chocolate milk and maple flavors. Frankly, they were a little watery tasting and kind of anemic, flavor-wise. The vanilla bean (which my daughter who was NOT celebrating a birthday got) was kind of disgusting. I did not try the peach or the plain "tart" flavors.

Why 4 stars, you might ask, given my lukewarm review of the froyo. Well I will tell you - two reasons: custard and topping selection. The custard, which comes in the same type of dispenser as the yogurt, and which is advertised as full fat -was truly DELICIOUS! The topping selection was diverse, everything looked delicious, and the cookie dough topping were these plump, robust moist chunks of chocolate chip cookie dough. Tasty. AND they have caramel and hot fudge sauce AS WELL AS hot peanut sauce and marshmallow topping. 

Really, despite the mediocre froyo itself, you can make yourself a tasty treat here. Which I did (despite the watery chocolate milk froyo in my bowl).

And it's all organic (who cares if the fro isn't particularly good, really) - and self serve.

I think they should make a full fat maple custard. Mmmmm. Will definitely return!
author: Judith S.

description: Delicious froyo! There are lots of options- tart, vanilla, chocolate, blueberry (sugar free), full fat custard, cake batter, huckleberry, blackberry, creme brulee, etc. The topping selection is money. There are plenty of fruit, candies, cereal, nuts, mochi, chocolates, etc. I wish they had smaller cups though because I have no self control.
author: Jen F.

description:
Simple ice cream flavors; but when coupled with their amazing toppings ... You get awesome frozen yogurt.

Quaint place. Everything is compostable. Toppings are great ... Not the largest selection, but the best quality. Frankly speaking, I'm not a big fan of the highly commercialized yogurt places that have 30 flavors and 50 toppings, but of mediocre quality.
author: Ankur V.

description:
Love these guys.

Froyo with tons of topping choices - you pay by weight so it works particularly well for those who like smaller portions.  Staff was friendly and courteous and product was tasty. 

A welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Kim R.

description:
I came here on a whim one day - I'm a big ice cream fan so fro-yo has never really been too exciting for me, but I thought I'd give it a shot. The setup is like many other fro-yo places in that you walk in, grab a cup, choose from their flavors (organic, non-fat, lots of fat, etc.), add toppings, and then pay.  Lives up to the "easy" part of the name. 

I tried a bit of everything and loved the custard.  I'm gluten-free so I had toppings that I could.  

I do wish they would mark and separate the gf items from the non.  Otherwise, it was great and priced pretty well (though may be on the expensive side of a self-serve dessert place).
author: Min M.

description: This place is my new favorite froyo spot! I was a Nubi loyalist, but I stumbled upon an even greater place. I came in yesterday around 3 or 4pm with my two boys and was immediately greeted by two wonderful ladies. I really love going into places where I'm immediately acknowledged. One of the girls offered us samples, and she talked to us about the flavors and how they make all the flavors fresh in the back, that's pretty great especially since all they use is organic and local products: that's extra points in my book. The price is a little bit pricey, but you pay for what you get - delicious yogurt. For me and my two boys came out to a total of $19.56 that was the small kids cup too. I'm willing to pay for good quality so it wasn't much for me. As I was paying the girls asked if we wanted a loyalty card, and of course I did, I will definitely be back more often, the young ladies were the sweetest to my boys. Now that's excellent customer service!
author: Jasmine R.

description: Favorite. Original is the best. Toppings are good and fresh. Always get more than I should. Relatively inexpensive.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Good, imaginative flavors like cayenne chocolate, but no non-dairy options. 

I do like that they have fun dispensers for the toppings though. And they locally source the ingredients for the fruit flavors! Yay locavores!
author: Katie B.

description: This is a nice branch of Easy Breezy. It's popular with families with children, so there's often not much seating, but the line is rarely long (unlike Bi-Rite Creamery, for example!). It's fairly inexpensive, and they have a good range of flavors, non-fat to full-fat custard, as well as dairy free. There are also a range of toppings, from colorful and sugary to fruit and nuts, although it seems like the range has been more on the unhealthy side recently.
author: Dominique G.

description: We love this place. Unique and tasty flavors. Its the go to bribe item for the kids. And its good for you too bc it frozen yogurt. Right?
author: Adrian F.

description:
Mmm yum Mmm yum! 

Such excellent flavors and great condiments/toppings to add.  

Shop itself has a lovely aesthetic with a nice big window for people watching while yo-gurting.
author: Maija S.

description:
Along with yogorino in the embarcadero this is probably the best frozen yogurt in the city.  Just had the vanbanana and it litterally tasted like someone cut up fresh bananas and placed it in silky smooth yogurt kissed with a hint of vanilla.  So why the 4 stars.  Well this place is pricey and probably eat here 2-3  per month as opposed to making it a weekly habit because a few squirts of yogurt can easily cost $5 here. 

Food 5 Stars
Service 4 Stars
Value 2 Stars
Atrmosphere 3 Stars
author: Christopher T.

description:
This is definitely one of our regular go to spots after dinner on 24th.  The list of choices are not overwhelming, simple but delicous.

Love the decor and the tables.  This might not be important to many, but having two little kids it makes all the difference to have comfortable seats, and a table you can eat at.
author: Gina C.

description: Solid fro yo.  Had the hella Nutella and it was awesome!  Super creamy and tasted like Nutella.  I would definitely go back to check out more of their flavors.  Gives loving cup a run for their money.  Only downside is convenience.  Hopefully they get closer to Russian Hill sometime.
author: Kirsten M.

description: The best frozen yogurt! Great variety of flavors, lots if toppings (the mango is always perfect), and no weird artificial flavors or fake sugar taste.
author: Steph K.

description: My first time going there was horrible. Bad service from this girl with a unibrow and i heard her yelling at a guy coworker saying "I'm going to kill you" and i don't find that appropriate when at work. I wont even go there again. Such a terrible experience.
author: Candy V.

description: Best fro yo in San Fran! The toppings that they provided are super delicious and it's very child friendly!
author: Julia K.

description: The tart was not so tart. The custard was creamy and delicious. The dutch chocolate was malty and the aztec chocolate had a spicy kick. Toppings were were fresh. Santa Cruz Organic dessert syrup offered as a topping. Hot fudge and caramel offered as toppings too. Location was lovely with lots of woodsy fixtures in its interior. I like the low ceiling, large window, benches, stools, and ramp walkway. Restroom was clean. Service was friendly and helpful even though it's a self-serve place.
author: Jennifer W.

description: We have a lot of frozen yogurt places in SF, but this one is my far my favorite! And I was so glad to hear that they might open a location in Inner Sunset. They have an immense amount of toppings: ranging from bacon pieces, to mochi, to chocolate truffles, and more. All the yogurt is organic, and delicious. It is a bit more expensive that most frozen yogurt, but totally worth it.
author: Nikita K.

description: Mango Lassi with fruity pebbles .winning. went back twice today. Staff was helpful. And the chocolate milk yogurt was pretty good too
author: Kenneth S.

description:
The chocolate custard was delish, and I love that they have both crushed potato chips and salt as toppings. 

It's on the pricey side, at what I believe to be 50 cents an ounce (I didn't see it posted anywhere), and significantly more expensive than Yogurtland.

Did I mention the chocolate custard? Super good, and they have hot fudge sauce, too.

The tart flavors were just meh (not super tart), and lovey got flavors that said "no added sugar." They were really sweet, though, and he went and checked afterwards, and sure enough: sugar was the second ingredient. 

He talked about it with one of the employees there, and was told that that meant that there was no sugar added on top of what was already in the froyo itself. That seems a bit misleading; what if someone who's diabetic thinks they're getting something with artificial sweetener? The communication could be better.

Overall: about $9 for the two of us for relatively small servings, but mine (did I mention the chocolate custard?) was super-tasty.
author: Adriana V.

description:
Very nice and friendly employees during the time I'd visited Saturday, right when it opened for the day + tasty self-serve fro-yo and a lovely assortment of toppings = I'm putting this down as my new favorite go-to fro-yo place in SF, for sure!  I tried the original tart fro-yo and the frozen custard soft-serve which was a chocolate flavored one and I thought they both tasted absolutely wonderful:-)  I think this is one of the few places out there that I know of that has self-serve frozen custard available - most places that have this don't offer it so that it's actually self-serve.  They have a wide assortment of toppings that you can choose from - everything from your normal sprinkles, bursting boba, mochi, peanut butter cups, fudge sauce, fresh fruit, crushed potato chips and more!   

I love how they use a lot of wood for their benches and tables, which creates for a cool, natural and inviting vibe.  They also have a water dispenser near the door, in case you forgot to bring your own water.  Though it's not really the most convenient place for me to get to, nor is it the cheapest self-serve fro-yo place around, I'd certainly pick this place over others due to the overall taste & quality of their fro-yo + frozen custard and also the fact that it's not chaotic inside (well at least when I went, it wasn't) and since it is self-serve, by the time you get to eat your fro-yo, it's not going to be half-melted.  During the time I stopped by, the employees informed me that they were giving out complimentary shopping/tote bags and to not forget to grab one, which was very nice of them!  Definitely looking forward to dropping by again one of these days to try out their other flavors + toppings!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
I've been watching over the last couple of months as they have been building and creating this new and exciting place for me to go and get my afternoon sweet tooth fix. Today on my way to get lunch my patience was rewarded! There on a sidewalk sign were some of the greatest words I've ever read..."Open Friday"

So now you ask how can I review a business that isn't open? 
Well thanks to the wonderful new owner! She invited us in, let us check it out and gave us a sample of a flavor I most likely never would have tried, Chocolate Custard (I'm not a chocolate guy...), and it was AMAZING!
The shop is decorated very well and will be ready to serve the taste buds of Noe Valley peeps for years to come.

Great new spot in the hood!
author: JR H.

description:
So yummy and the owners are so friendly!!! the yoghurt tastes so fresh every other frozen yoghurt place i have ever been to in my life (and thats alot) feels like it has been a joke! 

the custard was delicious! 

Two words: Organic fruit!!!
author: Yas G.

description:
Given how heavily they market to kids, I was shocked by how rude the staff was to my daughter.  Admittedly, my daughter touched the edge of one of the food containers as we were leaving; but the woman behind the counter ran over snatched the container off the counter, glared at my daughter, barked "you can't touch that!" in her face, and dumped the food in the garbage.  Trying to turn it into a teachable moment, I brought my daughter over to apologize, and the woman glared some more and said to her, "Well it is pretty obvious that you aren't supposed to touch food" and, and [turning to me], "And you clearly brought her over there to take one."  Umm, yeah, after paying $7 for 3 oz of crappy junk food, I felt like we needed a free stale chip. Then she said, "Kids touch the food all the time."
