Wow, gross,  So much for a lovely treat at the end of a long day.  Expensive and stressful and dirty.

I've always wondered how they got around the health code of requiring "sneeze guards" over self serve food? It's  pretty annoying that they put everything right at preschool-face-level (which probably sells more garbage, but is pretty disgusting if you think too much about it).
author: Jennifer K.

description:
My new favorite frozen yogurt spot in Noe Valley since Tuttimelon closes in 2011.
Easy Breezy provide self serve Yogurt in a very nice environment. You can go there grab a cup on the got and enjoy it on their nice wooded chairs and tables.

I like the variety of their flavors. It change on a weekly basis. Lately I've discovered their Nutella flavor which was pretty good as well and the popular Oreo Cookie. Most of them are low fat or non fat, so you can indulge as much as you want. But always be aware of the amount of sugar. That's usually more important than the fat content of such products. They do a good job a displaying nutritional facts, so the information is easy to find.

They do offer sample, so feel free to ask and sample as much as you want ;) 

My favorite place for Frozen Yogurt still remain Fraiche, but if Easy Breezy they can go all organic & local as well, I might reconsider this statement :-)
author: Cedric L.

description: Fabulous flavors -  coconut cream pie is a favorite. Friendly staff..
author: Vicki L.

description:
I'll admit it.  I'm a sucker for frozen yogurt.  It took me awhile to get on board with the tart trend but once I met Easy Breezy, I fell.  Hard.  

Their plain tart is the best and while they have toppings like candied bacon and potato chips, there's also a bunch of more standard toppings including fruit and crushed up candy bars.  

Be prepared.  There's a good chance you'll trip over a few strollers on your way in the door.   They advertise a family friendly atmosphere and they mean it.  The Noe Valley mommy mafia totally runs this joint.  

On the plus side, they don't let you get your own samples.  It means the machines are well maintained and really clean.  

Bonus points: They stay open until 10pm.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
I was skeptical when I heard this place was opening - wasn't the froyo fad years ago? 

Well, this place is no passing fad! The frozen custard is creamy and delicious. If you want something lighter, I've had a mixed berry flavor that tasted just like a fresh smoothie. The regular tart flavor is also solid. Lots of fresh looking topping options. I'm definitely going to be a regular!

Pick up a stamp card to get a free froyo, and also free easy breezy reusable bags for a limited time (i love these - they have wide, sturdy bottoms)!
author: Erin Y.

description: I visited an Easy Breezy in Inner Sunset and was not impressed and sadly, I have to give this location 3 stars, as my experience wasn't any better Like other users have said, it's a great place to get your fro-yo fix but it isn't anything special. It's really overpriced, especially considering you can find other places that offer same thing for half the price. Also, on this day it was so hot and humid inside of the place, even some of the toppings looked like they were melting. My friend and I had to sit outside because  They have a good range of flavors that change often. I recently tried the Island Banana and I really liked it. The workers were very nice and polite, they even let you try as many samples as you would like. I will probably be back because it is only about a block from my apartment but I can't say that it's the best I've ever had.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I'm glad Noe finally opened a yogurt shop!

Pros: great flavors which they mix up often, delicious taste and texture, lots of toppings and some unique ones too!

Cons: Difficult to get samples (you need to ask someone behind the counter and if there is a line or someone is paying, it takes too long - best to give people sample cups and let them do it themselves.

The biggest con is the price - VERY EXPENSIVE - they charge 50 cents an ounce, but with the yogurt being on the heavier side it adds up quickly! Even compared to Pinkberry it's pricey! it will usually run you $7-$8 if you fill the cup and that's easy to do since the yogurt comes out fast.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Self-Server frozen yogurt with every topping imaginable (sprinkles, mochi, olive oil, hot fudges, potato chips! and all the regulars).  Look into the refrigerated section near the cash register for fruits and perishables-- easy to miss!  The cost is per ounce-- gotta love that-- you pay for as much or a little as you want!

They have rotating flavors and toppings... AND they serve frozen custard!!!!! If you want to add a little guilt to your cup-- try this stuff. Super creamy, so rich and delicious. 

High quality ingredients, many organic, and super friendly and helpful customer service. This little spot was much needed on this street!  Get a punch card and receive your 11th cup free!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Well, now I can never move. I was happy enough to see a frozen yogurt place open in Noe Valley, but Easy Breezy has best yogurt I think I have ever had -- the kind that makes me wish I had been more discerning in previous 5-star reviews. Ah, well. Given exactly how divine it is, I think the proximity to my apartment  is going to be a bit problematic, as I've been there practically daily since it opened (it's that good).

The outstanding flavors, for me, were: Chocolate Custard (and I don't even LIKE chocolate that much); Raspberry (which tastes like real, tart raspberries -- not like what you would expect); and Cake Batter (which, unlike the overly saccharine flavor that cake batter yogurt can sometimes have -- this tastes like actual cake batter). 

This yogurt is so good, I have yet to taint it with toppings (nothing against them, though -- they look amazing, too). 

As a random side note, I love the mascot (and the cute merch) -- the tote bags are really generous (thank you!), and the tattoos are a really cute idea for kids. The tees are adorable.
author: Katie M.

description:
This was a taste of home. For those of you whom have lived in or passed through the midwest, you know what Culver's is, and how much I miss their frozen custard. Easy Breezy has a machine that pumps out vanilla custard that is 95% as good as Culver's, which is as close as it's probably going to get out here.

Top it with a bit of hot caramel, and you've got a happy Amanda.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I'm not a dessert person but I can easily be convinced to stop by Easy Breezy.

There seems to be a new flavor every day. I always try a taste but usually end up with tart in the end. Except when they have banana, it is so good! The only downside to having a new flavor every day is that when you find one you love you never know when it will be back again.

I find the toppings to be more unique and seasonal than other frozen yogurt places. Currently, I am obsessed with the passion fruit boba balls as toppings. I've never had these any place else and I am sometimes tempted to go in and just fill a cub with these and nothing else.

I love that the place is simple in decor and everything is compostable.  Easy Breezy is overall a pleasant place to eat, the warm colors are more inviting than the fluorescent, institutional feel I usually get in other yogurt places. Also, the staff are so nice!
author: Ariel M.

description: I'm a huge fan. The owner gave me samples of everything and answered questions about the flavors. He was very friendly and pleasant. They even have an almond milk chocolate flavor, which is amazing. Since I'm lactose intolerant, this is a dream. I ended up going with the coconut cream pie and key lime flavors with some graham cracker topping and fruit, it was delicious. I will become a regular, I'm sure of it.
author: Madeline S.

description:
I really wanted to love this place since the decor is so cute, atmosphere and cashiers were super friendly and inviting - BUT (the inevitable but...) there wasn't much choices (yogurt & toppings), the yogurt was almost too sweet and VERY EXPENSIVE. $$$$$
My boyfriend, however, loved the Vanilla Custard and all the fruit toppings were fresh and ripe. Maybe I'll come back when they have a better variety of flavors since it seems they change often.
author: S. M.

description: Maybe I went on an off day but the yogurt was really watery and blah.  I also didn't find the "special" ice cream (not yogurt but real ice cream) to be good.  There was definitely something off.  It was also weirdly hard to get a sample, which seems strange for a froyo place.  I'm frequently desperate for ice cream but even I won't come back here... probably.
author: Amy M.

description:
Love love 
Favorite fro yo in the city!!! 
Custard is so great :) on my way
author: mary k.

description: This place is pretty good. Friendly staff, clean digs, okay flavors. It's self-serve and they charge by weight. Some options are organic. A solid 3 stars.
author: Sandy G.

description: Quick, very tasty, convenient, well priced and heaps of options offered for toppings. The place is clean and has good service.
author: Livia M.

description:
Yum! There is so much mediocre frozen yogurt out there. When my friend brought me here, I was so pleasantly surprised. Organic! Interesting flavors! And it tastes like real food. 

Some of the best frozen yogurt anywhere. And did I mention it's organic?
author: L H.

description: I opted for the non-fat mixed berry froyo.  I added fresh blueberries which I didn't notice were available until after I paid.  The guy at the counter said not to worry about it--he let me add them for free.  Take it easy on the self-serve handles--you could wind up with quite a bit of product.  You might not mind though--their flavors are really good. ( I sampled the "chocolate milk" froyo too.)
author: Thomas D.

description: Great froyo with an alternative custard option. Liked that they had a more curated variety of frozen treats. Hands down best part were...hot marshmellow and hot peanut butter toppings. Sort of a nice change from the ubiquitous Yogurtlands and Pinkberrys of the world. Tahoe ski lodge-inspired decor. All in all, a winner!
author: Andrew K.

description: Frozen yogurt on 24th! They don't have all the toppings that you expect at a lot of frozen yogurt places (like mango or blueberry) :(. But yum...
author: Thomas C.

description:
OMG I just love having Easy Breezy on 24th Street...now I am a Pinkberry fan but this place could turn me...
The banana flavor is too die for...seriously...I will kill someone for it (okay not really but it's that good, please no one call the cops). The nutella is also a favorite...but of course you can't go wrong with the classic tart. 
My one minor complaint is the shaker dispensers for the sprinkles...it just doesn't allow enough of those delicious sprinkles to exit the shaker without me looking like I'm playing the maracas! Oy! 
Okay I have another complaint...it is pricey. Maybe I'm just heavy handed but my cups average about $7 (that's mostly yogurt b/c you know those sprinkles don't weigh much)...yikes!
Whatever, we will keep coming back to patronize this place even if we go broke!
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: This place is awesome!!! Great choices and the staff was really nice letting us sample the different flavors.
author: Stephen A.

description: Friendly, happy help.  Organic, yogurt with truly rich, flavorful options.  YUM,
author: Lxs S.

description:
Yogurt and atmosphere are fabulous but I have had to stop going
To easy breezy bc half the time I so they are not open during their posted biz hours. Often there is a sign saying "be back at 2" or something so I wait and they
Are still not back at that time. I have watched so many
Customers come and go while they are closed. I don't understand how they run a business!  I have had to take my kids to Noe valley
Bakery instead many times bc of the promise of yogurt and an unexpected closure.
author: Dana B.

description: Only place I've seen in San Francisco that has soft serve _ice cream_, AND here, it's custard! Full cream, delicious texture. For custard, they only have vanilla and chocolate, but they're amazing. Also they have approximately 5 billion toppings.
author: Ashley M.

description: Great flavors, nice staff, creative toppings (artisinal salt!) And nice area to sit inside or out. And a frequent shipper card! Whippee!
author: Antonia T.

description:
Nice and close to my house, reasonably priced, and they switch up the flavors! 

The toppings are fun ranging from the norm to crunched up potato chips.  Price is done by weight, and there are usually one or two people working to help you out if you have any questions.

Pick up a punch card, you know you'll be back.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Pretty good frozen yogurt with the standard complement of toppings. The decor indoors is nice and clean. This is a by the ounce yogurt place.

Only negative is that there are a lot of younger kids in the area and the place tends to get quite hectic and rowdy. Otherwise an excellent place to get yogurt if you need a fix.
author: Will S.

description: This is our go-to frozen yogurt place, mostly because it's geographically convenient. But tonight we met Brian, the most charming and sweet froyo slinger in the world. If the delicious and innovative flavors of easy breezy froyo are the draw, Brian's ebullient demeanor and enthusiasm are the rainbow sprinkles on top.
author: Jim F.

description:
amazing nontraditional atmosphere and decor.
most of the froyo is bleh but viet coffee froyo is gret and the FROZEN CUSTARD IS A MUST GET. they have great toppings including bacon bits, olive oil, balsamic, etc. 
i recommend asking for a sample of the froyo before getting it. 
the mint chocolate is not good. 
good toppings are the peanut butter sauce and they also have chocolate truffles. 

overall, 5 stars for the atmosphere, frozen custard and nice ingredients as well as interesting toppings.
author: Jess C.

description:
FROZEN CUSTARD IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!
WOOOOOHOOOOOOO
i hope they make it big!!
i have no idea how california claims to have happy cows yet barely anyone here knows what frozen custard is!
i just hope they start having flavors for their custard like they do for their yogurt.....  its only fair ;-)
i do wish they would have a sign explaining what frozen custard is.
author: beth m.

description: Really great! The full-fat frozen yogurt is the BEST and like the ad says "worth it".
author: Jenna A.

description:
Wish it were closer.

Frozen yogurt AND frozen custard. High quality. Been here three times and tried different flavors and combos. Super fresh and the place is clean and lovely.

I would not put chips on my yogurt but was with a friend who lives by and swears by it. Who new? Something of everyone.

Strauss yogurt, excellent services, samples for picky hubby who I think just wanted to have a bit before how extra large serving:)

Love. Love.
author: Dani K.

description: I really love this place! They always have a vegan flavor and they make everything from scratch. They make new flavor creations every week and they totally take customer suggestions!! It's a cute environment and the soft sever is freakin delicious!! A great place to take the kids or just to stop by on a hot day!!
author: Sharmila G.

description: YUM YUM. I literally can't walk past here with my wife without going in. She loves it.
author: Oliver B.

description: Awesome Strauss fro to with yummy toppings in a warm setting. They support local public schools too.
author: olivia b.

description: Expensive compared to other self-service yogurt options, but the taste is fine, and they sometimes have non-standard options like frozen custard. Be warned that they play really awful Top 40-type music, and they play it LOUDLY.
author: Gaelen X.

description: If you find yourself within a 15 block radius of Easy Breezy with a kid under 10 and DON'T bring them there, you're a bad person.
author: Adam M.

description:
First impressions? Excellent. the vibe is awesome in here, it's bright and cheery and they play rad reggae music. Instant 1-up in my book. 
The frozen yogurt not only tastes awesome but the texture is incredibly creamy! It's amazing! Definitely some of my favorite frozen yogurt in San Francisco. 
Great choice of toppings as well, from the usual (fruit, chocolate chips, yogurt chips, pb cups) to the unusual (organic mochi, potato chips, PEANUT BUTTER PRETZELS (!!!), and it's all organic. Big plus! 
Some great flavors round out the fantastic sweet and salty combination possibilities, making this one of my top choices for frozen yogurt in San Francisco, possibly only behind the likes of Loving Cup and at least as good as Fraiche. 

[1 Small froyo with toppings, per oz. (sorry I forgot the price)]
[Orgainic and creative toppings, rotating flavors, fresh froyo]
[Go go go!]
author: Asher G.

description:
I have been waiting for them to open and they finally did.  My friend and I went today and absolutely loved it.  The texture of the yogurt was so smooth compared to other places.  We shared a cup and had the plain tart flavor and the cake batter flavor.  To quote my friend "this is the best tart yogurt I ever had".  The cake batter flavor was seriously like licking the spatula clean from a cake bowl.  It tasted exactly like cake batter but low fat in yogurt form.    

There were plenty of topping options but just a few berries are enough because the yogurt is so amazing by itself.  It might be because they use Straus brand milk.   

The employees were nothing but friendly.  I hope this gem stays open forever! You can definitely taste how fabulous this place is compared the old tutimellon yogurt that was on 24th.

I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Michele S.

description: One of the best frozen yogurt in the city. Has no eggs.
author: Vinod K.

description: Froyo flavors were amazeballs!!! Many yummy toppings but was kinda disappointed with the frozen custard 1, expected more after hearing all the hype about it :/
author: Jenny N.

description: At first I was hesitant to try their flavors but after I did I loved it! Great place to go to and great area to walk around and eat your yogurt!
author: Jared B.

description: Great service! Best toppings! One of the few places that has toasted coconut topping, marshmallow cream, potato chips, hot peanut butter sauce. Yum!
author: Deanna T.

description: I love the fact that you can put all the toppings you like... pay by weight! Custard is great and everything is organic here.
author: Anwar H.

description: I have been eating yogurt for over thirty years on a daily basis. I moved to the area recently and found this place. i actually would not have moved to an area that didn't have a yogurt store. Easy Breezy has a great assortment of flavors and they are open to trying to develop new ones. It is not the standard store where they just pour yogurt in machine with flavoring. For example, in the flavor 'cheesequake', which is absolutely incredible, they put in sour cream and graham cracker. It tastes like a rich and wonderful cheesecake.The have non dairy options which are great for those with such dietary restrictions. Some of these have been cucumber, grapefruit, nutter butter. I cannot comment on toppings as I do not eat them. There does seem to be a good variety including ones for all age groups. There are the sweet candy type and then the nuts and doughs. One of my favorite things are two of the people that work there. Bailey is just joyous and smiles all the time. One thing really special about her is she really loves the product. She gets excited talking about yogurt flavors. It is so great to see an employee enjoy what she is doing and sharing the enthusiasm that I, yogurt lover, have when I go in there. Another employee that shines is Magaly. She is so kind, sweet and shares a smile whenever greeting me. She enjoys yogurt too. I applaud the store for really finding employees that know how to have a focus on superior customer service as well as product knowledge.
author: Pamela S.

description: I came here for the gangster-ass name, though I'm sure the owners didn't intend it to be so.  Turns out the stuff is good, and the custard is as ridic as everyone claims it to be.  Be prepared to spend more than you usually would for froyo, though.
author: Victoria G.

description: I like the decor of the place and the cozy neighborhood.  I didn't try everything but I liked the tart and the toffee coffee flavor was good.
author: ray s.

description: I've passed this place a million times and finally stopped in for the sake of a friend.  Oh my gosh.  Delicious yogurt, organic fruit?, and potato chip toppings?  How have I been missing this?
author: beverly l.

description: Love this place! Stumbled on it by complete accident but so glad that I did. Love the feel and vibe of this place along with the amazing flavors and toppings. Will be frequenting this place often.
author: Bradley V.

description: Easy Breezy is a welcome addition to the 24th Street corridor. Like many people in the neighborhood, I like retail and restaurants on the main drag (not banks and real estate companies). I love Easy Breezy's interior design and cutesy fro-yo icon. I also think their frozen yogurt is delicious! It's tasty and organic and they have a decent selection, with information above each flavor to guide you. I know it must be expensive as heck to rent the space, so obviously they have to make back their rent and then some in order to be profitable. And quality costs more, as it should! But even still, my husband and I were like, "Whoa!" when we put what we thought was a moderately sized yogurt on the scale and were told we owed them almost seven bucks! Aside from that, the place is a real win for Noe Valley and we will be regulars (but we'll be a little easier on the dispenser next time).
author: Jessica L.

description: pricey froyo, but that vanilla custard is to die for, beware though as it is FULL fat
author: Long C.

description: Super creamy and delicious flavors. I have to go with the tart everywhere I go and this place does not disappoint! Not a very wide variety of toppings but they do score extra points for unique toppings (potato chips, bacon and figs).
author: Lissette V.

description: Glad this place finally opened up! They have great yogurt, and they seem to be doing a good job of changing out the flavors on a regular basis. They're got all the usual suspects (vanilla, chocolate, etc.), but also some slightly more exotic fare (the spicy Aztec chocolate was particularly good, and genuinely spicy). The topping selection is also great, once again ranging from standard (nuts, coconut) to a little more out there (potato chips). As for the service, I think that might be even better than the yogurt. Each time we've been in, there's been a very friendly greeter there to steer everyone in the right direction. They're really knowledgeable about yogurt (which, quite frankly, I'd never given any serious thought to), and are happy to tell you about everything that goes into making it (they apparently mix the flavors in-house).
author: Pat M.

description:
The *best* frozen yogurt shop ever.  Why?

1.  The *custard* - I know, ironic, but so good.
2.  Salted caramel - mmmmm.
3.  Cookie dough topping - I could eat this by itself.
4.  Fruit toppings were super fresh.

And it's a super cute shop to boot with benches outside.

I didn't notice high prices, I thought $3 was totally appropriate for my medium-ish sized froyo.
author: Cathy L.

description: What a cute little yogurt shop. All the interior design is wooden. With nice soft lighting, this place feels really cozy and totally lay back. Very stylish. The staff is also super friendly. I highly recommend!
author: Jessie C.

description: I like this spot.  I did the Fro Yo craze in the '80's so this is a second time around for me.  There is always a flavor I'm happy with, my kids can get a reasonable portion, and the toppings are fun.  It's clean & they compost everything.
author: Kat M.

description: There's a special place in my heart for Easy Breezy. This place changes their menu regularly, and dares to go where no fro-yo place dares to go. They usually have very exotic flavors for those who like to challenge their taste buds; like cayenne chocolate, cucumber, and banana creme pie. They also cater to those faint of heart with common flavors like tart, chocolate, and custard. Also, their employees are very helpful when you're having a hard time choosing. Definitely a place to check out while in Noe Valley.
author: Joseph P.

description: They offer the best frozen yogurt toppings in the city. They have heated sauces, too, like hot fudge. I took my daughters here on one occasion and they even had crumbled bacon! They didn't try it, but we were certainly impressed.
author: John D.

description: 2.5? 2.75? It's hard to complain about froyo. But upper Noe born and bred, like other Noe establishments there's an air of boug to Easy Breezy. Yogurt was definitely good, pricing seemed fine. Toppings selections were good but felt a little limited. Convenience of having a froyo spot close to my hood within walking distance even? Great! (May have written this review just to say there was an "air of boug" somewhere on yelp.)
author: Niki M.

description: Hmmm, frozen yogurt right in my hood! Not a huge selection of flavors but I never get anything but original tart, so that matters not. I like the texture and taste of the yogurt. I'm not a froyo connoisseur, but this tastes like all the other good quality franchise (Menchies, Yogurtland, etc) and I'm satisfied with it.  Great selection of toppings with all ur usual nuts and candies and fruits and a bit more --- I'll have to give bacon bits a try next time!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Yum! Just what 24th St needed. Yummy yogurt, interesting flavors and my favorite, frozen CUSTARD!
author: Chris W.

description: Decide to have dessert after ward. Get frozen yogurt .Nice place and staff was friendly. Self service frozen yogurt, offer sample when ask. Good selection of ice cream, and topping. Their ice cream is consist thick not watery, charge per pound. I would recommend if you like frozen ice cream.
author: Gruber T.

description: The chocolate custard is to die for!  Best frozen yogurt anywhere.
author: Melanie L.

description:
Frozen yogurt and frozen custard in the same shop? That's a couple of stars just for the awesome. And this street needs a good froyo place and that's a couple of stars just for the convenience.

Generally you're going to enjoy everything here. The yogurt is absolutely top-notch and the machines are brand new and do a great job on texture. Toppings are super - as many savory as sweet and that's a nice twist.  (Potato chips! Who knew?)

True, it's a bit pricey, but we're talking prime 24th st. location and a clean attractive place staffed by friendly people serving Strauss organic yogurt. I think you get what you're paying for. If you want the inexpensive artificial stuff, go elsewhere...
author: Al M.

description:
Yogurt is damn good as are the toppings, so no knocks there.

We went at a particularly crowded time on a particularly warm day and the service couldn't seem to keep pace with the crowd. The lines for the register and the lines to the yogurt machines sort of fuse together making things very confusing. There were no spoons or small tasting cups accessible, had to duck around a bunch of people to ask the register guy for some. He instead came around and served me my tastes...whatever.

Sitting in the window eating my yogurt, however, made me very happy.

I'll go back for the yogurt but they have to figure out how to make the place flow a little better!
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Would have given 5 stars if not for how expensive this place is. The yogurt and custard are the best I have ever had.  Will have to get a second job to pay for this addiction!
author: Janelle D.

description: Fabulous taste. I find it a little on the outrageous side to pay $10.23 for 15.05 oz of yogurt which is less volume than a pint (16oz) of, The Latest Scoop brand Gelato made in Berkeley Ca, which is a top notch ice cream sold for $6.99 in the stores, which is close to half the price at .44/oz and Cold Stone at .48/oz.  I'm all for paying for quality and yes you get what you pay for but this has gone too far. In addition, they didn't have the small kids size cup, which was part of the problem, so you are naturally going to spend more filling up the next bigger size, hard as you may try to not fill it up. Again, amazing taste, great job, but I find this little store on the monopolizing side of the house. Perfect location where persons may be fooled that yogurt should cost this much. Like hell it should. Hey Breezy, how about competing with Cold Stone and Latest Scoop, don't get greedy asking 25% more just because it's yogurt and a notch healthier. Dave M.
author: Dave M.

description: So so happy to have a frozen yogurt place 3 blocks from my apartment now! They have great flavors that rotate (though I wish they had kept the Nutella one around longer!) and a great selection of toppings! I've had nothing but good experiences with the staff too, they are always smiling and asking if I want samples which I love!
author: Simona M.

description: Easy Breezy is a very comfortable place to go for a treat of frozen yogurt.  The flavors were very creative ... I have never seen cake batter frozen yogurt before, and it was tasty!!  The service was very nice too - perky and extremely helpful.  And, the flavors of the week are easy to look up on Facebook.   I am looking forward to returning.
author: Julie N.

description: Yum, a sweet treat for 24th street! Easy Breezy is open in Noe Valley and it's perfect. The staff is friendly, helpful, and happy to give samples of the delicious flavors of fro yo. The toppings are plentiful, and you can mix-and-match however you like. The decor feels natural and welcoming like a Malibu beach home. Look for the happy Easy Breezy mascot and try the best fro yo in San Francisco.
author: Joel H.

description: So awesome. Special flavors change weekly and are usually amazing (Nutella today!). Low & no fat options along with fruit and other great toppings (hello Heath bar). Staff is really friendly and happy to let you try a flavor. And everything is compostable to ease your guilty conscience. What's not to love?!?
author: Trishan A.

description: Everyone is praising Easy Breezy, but are they blind to the worst user experience in Froyo history?  Let's start with the way the machines shoot out froyo like lava.  Part of the self-service experience is being able to control the way the froyo coils in your cup AND to control how much froyo you are buying.  Before I knew it, I had over 9 dollars of froyo in my cup.  9 dollars!!  That's problem number 1.  Next we have the caroseul of toppings.  These toppings also launch at a rapid pace giving you little control over the volume you are building in your cup.  And there are three toppings stations.  One by the checkout counter, which is logical.  The second is squished next to the checkout corner and the row of froyo machines and the third is past the checkout counter.  If there are more than three people in the place, it's pretty cumbersome to navigate this obstacle course.  There's absolutely no logical flow.  Have the owners never seen a Yogurtland or a Menchi's?  It's not rocket science.  Dedicate space for yogurt next to a dedicated space for toppings which then leads you to the checkout counter.  The price per ounce is about 50 cents or more, which is high for froyo.  I'll say that they have interesting flavors and actual hot fudge and some cool toppings, but the UX is so poor that I'd almost rather go without froyo at all.  Everything is set up for you to wait longer than you need to and pay more than you would want.  It should really be called Easy Breezy Pay Us All Your Cash.
author: Jeremy G.

description: This place has great organic Frozen yogurt. I love frozen treats, I have been trying ice cream and frozen yogurt around the city and this is one of the best. YOU MUST TRY THE FROZEN CUSTARD its is simply AMAZING
author: Sulaiman B.

description: awesome spot, original flavors, very adventurous toppings- and its not a chain, its local-family owned. loved this place and will be coming back for more!
author: Carolina S.

description: Yummy!! This is real tart yogurt, not the artificially flavored kind.  I tried strawberry, tart, peanut butter, and all were delicious.  There was also frozen custard.  Big selection of toppings and sauces.  A little expensive though, something like 50 cents per ounce.  -1 for the lines and the slow children who take forever choosing toppings.
author: T Y.

description: a froyo place right in my hood. finally! love mixing the original tart with one of the sweet flavors (get the frozen custard ... techincally not froyo but so worth all the extra fat and calories!). it's hard to exhibit self control since i pass by this place at least a few times a week, but i think indulging here once a week isn't that bad, says my inner (and outer!) fat kid.
author: cynthia q.

description: I watched with interest as the Easy Breezy was built and opened near my house, especially when I found out they use local strauss organic yogurt and organic toppings. Still, I'm not a huge froyo person so although I'd walk by and think, oh that looks good, I was never in the mood to try them. Till the heat wave. I love hot weather! And last Monday, it was HOT! Even after the sun sets, which is so rare here in SF! Thinking of childhood memories of going for ice cream on hot summer nights in new England, I decided this was the time to try it. I saw they had raspberry tart, yum. I walked in, it's very small, three machines with two flavors each, four basic flavors and two special rotating flavors, a bunch of tables and chairs up the front, and some tucked in corners toppings. One machine with chocolate and something was blocked off. Odd. The family in front of me went over to get some raspberry tart yogurt. But the employee rushed over and said that due to the heat, the machine had broken down, and that's what happened to the other one too. Ironic that something that would be good to beat the beat got beaten itself. Only one machine was working, plain tart, and plain custard. The kids in front of me got all upset and their parents took them to find ice cream instead. I thought about leaving but then decided to try these plain flavors. I got mainly tart, with a bit of custard (which is not frozen  yogurt or fat free the sign says) on top. With little flavor in my ice cream, I picked some toppings that would give me the most flavor - organic fruit and lychee boba. Mixed in, I got fruit yogurt, except that then it kind of  muddled between the custard and the tart. I took as much as I wanted without worrying about the price, and it only cost $4.50. It was good! Not too sweet at all, which I liked. I didn't feel a sugar rush. I enjoy plain yogurt anyway (usually with fruit or as a topping) so someone who doesn't may not like it. I would love to come back when they have actual flavors and try those, or maybe the chocolate sauce. I've seen yummy flavors like lemon or acai advertised. Plus, although this place is popular and there's always people outside eating their frozen yogurt, you don't have to put up with long lines like you do at the ice cream places that are closest to us. Those ice creams are probably a little bit tastier, but not always worth waiting an hour, and this place is tasty too, and way more healthy!
author: Merredith L.

description: Went here last night for yogurt after dinner and I have to say it was the best yogurt ever. They have amazing topping options and the staff is great. Will definitely be going back
author: J J.

description: Awesome froze yogurt. They don't have too many flavor options (I haven't tried the custard yet I've heard people love it) BUT they have a ton of toppings to choose from and the fruit is always fresh. It is a great addition to Noe Valley
author: Cat J.

description: Finally some dessert in Noe Valley!  A good variety of toppings and a nice range of froyo flavors to choose from.  My fave is the cake batter with some delicious cheesecake bits, and lots of other toppings (i love toppings!).  And everyone is super nice there too.  Can get a little pricey, but if they had a happy hour, I would be there every day.
author: Maryann G.

description: I'm a frozen yogurt expert, it's my favorite food and this is by far the best I've ever had.  So excited to have found this gem!
author: Briana B.

description: Amaaaaazing! Amazing amazing amazing! The frozen custard is to die for, and this is one of the very few places where one can top one's froyo with marshmallow creme, peanut butter sauce, peanut butter cups, and bacon! You really can't beat that!
author: V R.

description: My favorite fro-yo place in San Francisco.  Actually, it is the best I have found anywhere.  They make a special treat less guilt ridden by offering mostly organic frozen yogurt options with the base from a local supplier (Strauss from Tomales Bay area).  Being organic and natural doesn't take away from the yum-factor; it tastes great!  You can alway sin a little if you want since there is an amazing assortment of  topping options.  Enjoy!
author: Ralph W.

description: Damn fine frozen yogurt!  Interesting flavors but a couple staple flavors you can always count on.  The toppings range from the usual to novel, which makes it interesting to mix and match.  It can get a little expensive but if you don't go all the time, it's worth it!
author: Mike I.

description: Finally self-serve frozen yogurt (etc.) in Noe Valley! It's on the *very* pricey side, but gotta expect that in Noe, and I presume the quality of the ingredients reflects the prices. The pour was a little watery, though, ... happens everywhere from time to time, but I hope it's not common at Easy Breezy.
author: T G.

description: Pretty cute little spot for frozen yoghurt.
author: X O.

description: Why is this the first time I've tried a self-serve ice cream bar? Like a salad bar but less healthy. YUM!
author: Megan C.

description: good stuff! i love that you pay by the ounce -- i don't need a vat of frozen yogurt, just a wee bit now and then. lots of flavor choices, and they're helpfully marked in terms of lowfat, nonfat, etc. the yoges has a nice creamy consistency -- it's not brain-freezingly cold, as at some places. it's a bit confusing, however, to have some toppings in a kiosk in the center of the store and other toppings at the register -- if it's crowded you might not see the latter til it's too late. (this has happened to me the two times i have been here, and it's been a bummer because they have some good-looking toppings like brownie bits and various fruits near the register.) i also wish they offered little tasting cups at each yogurt stand so you could try a flavor by yourself, as there isn't always an employee available to give you a sample. also! i just read that they give out punch cards! i did not see any there. rats. solid 4 stars -- with a few improvements, they'd be a 5.
author: m r.
